page.title: 02THE CHURCH OF ST. ETA
page.content: { Stands on the bank of the Severn, dedicated to a{Celtic Saint, Bishop of {Lindisfarne}678 AD. N. wall Saxon using stones from Roman city of {Uriconium. Rest of church no later than 13th century. E.window has medieval glass. N.wall window Tudor glass is a memorial to QE1's chief lady-in-waiting,{Blanche Parry. Vicar's stall woodwork illustrates Prodigal Son, by{Durer. Roof 1603, S.Porch 1685. Six bells cast by{Rudhall of Gloucester,}1709. Organ by{Holdich,}1858, notable for excellent carving. This Anglican church is now served from St.Giles , Shrewsbury.
